title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, August 16, 1862
summary: Hotchkiss relates the results of the Battle of Cedar Run, including killed, wounded, prisoners and arms taken. He also describes the Federal efforts to find and bury their dead.
keywords: Military Authority, Death/Casualties, Battle Description, Medicine/Hospitals, Patriotism, Desertion/Leave, Church/Religious Activity, Slavery, African Americans, American Civil War
